events.message: The customer reported a vehicle collision involving their car and another vehicle causing front-end damage.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident as the incident involved a car collision.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the claim and to liaise with the customer for further processing.
The claim was formally acknowledged and the customer was informed that an investigation will soon commence.
The customer was requested to submit the accident report and photographic evidence of the vehicle damage.
The customer submitted all requested documents including the police report and vehicle damage photos promptly.
The investigation into the details and circumstances of the vehicle collision has officially begun.
The investigation concluded that the accident was caused by the other driver running a red light.
A settlement offer was proposed to cover repair costs of the vehicle based on the investigation findings.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the settlement proposal and confirmed agreement to the compensation.
The claim was officially approved following customer acceptance of the settlement offer.
Payment was issued to the customer's bank account to cover the authorized repair expenses.
The claim was formally closed after successful payment and confirmation of repair completion.
All claim-related documentation was archived in accordance with company policy for record-keeping.
